author: Chinua Achebe
title: Things Fall Apart
description: Set in pre-colonial Nigeria, this novel tells the story of a man named Okonkwo, whose life is disrupted by the arrival of European missionaries.

author: Hans Christian Andersen
title: Fairy tales
description: This collection of classic fairy tales includes stories such as 'The Little Mermaid' and 'The Ugly Duckling'.

author: Dante Alighieri
title: The Divine Comedy
description: Considered one of the greatest works of Italian literature, this epic poem tells the story of Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

author: Sin-leqi-unninni
title: The Epic Of Gilgamesh
description: One of the earliest known works of literature, this epic poem tells the story of the legendary king Gilgamesh and his quest for immortality.

author: Unknown
title: The Book Of Job
description: Part of the Hebrew Bible, this book tells the story of Job, a wealthy man who suffers a series of misfortunes and questions God's justice.

author: Antoine Galland
title: One Thousand and One Nights
description: Also known as the Arabian Nights, this collection of tales from the Middle East includes classics such as 'Aladdin and the Magic Lamp' and 'Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves'.

author: samundr frodi
title: Njál's Saga
description: This Icelandic saga tells the story of Njál Thorgeirsson and his family, and the violent conflicts that arise between them and their neighbors.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Set in 19th century England, this novel tells the story of Elizabeth Bennet and her complicated relationship with the wealthy Mr. Darcy.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: Le Père Goriot
description: This novel explores the theme of social class in 19th century France, focusing on the relationship between a father and his two daughters.

author: Samuel Beckett
title: Molloy, Malone Dies, The Unnamable, the trilogy
description: This trilogy of novels by the acclaimed Irish writer Samuel Beckett explores themes of identity, language, and the meaning of existence.

author: Giovanni Boccaccio
title: The Decameron
description: Set during the Black Death in 14th century Italy, this collection of stories follows a group of young people who flee to the countryside to escape the plague.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: Ficciones
description: This collection of short stories by the Argentine writer Jorge Luis Borges includes some of his most famous works, such as 'The Garden of Forking Paths' and 'Tlön, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius'.

author: Emily Brontë
title: Wuthering Heights
description: Set in the wilds of Yorkshire, this novel tells the story of the passionate and destructive love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline
title: Journey to the End of the Night
